INSIGHT: Here are some of the biggest takeaways from our recent analysis of AI trading bots — from Telegram sniper bots to CEX signal strategies. Spoiler: some bots crushed markets, others… not so much. 
 #CryptoBots #AITrading

And DCA bots? Mixed. Underperformed on BTC, but crushed it on volatile assets like SOL (+80.9% vs -18% buy-and-hold).
Different bots. Different strengths. Choose based on your goals.

Not all bots fit all traders:
 Telegram bots = fast memecoin plays & sniping tokens
 AI bots = experimental & autonomous
 CEX/DEX bots = pro tools for strategy traders
Choose based on your risk + style.
 #CryptoTools #DeFi
Telegram bots are booming. Trojan alone generated $109M in fees. SolTradingBot had smaller volume but more consistent daily revenue.
JUST IN: Justin Sun claims “Bitcoin is the future” after the Fed announced the withdrawal of crypto guidance for banks.

NEW: Nasdaq Calls for Clearer Digital Asset Rules in Letter to SEC

In a new letter, Nasdaq urges the SEC to create a regulatory framework that properly classifies digital assets, arguing they can fit into existing markets with the right oversight.

JUST IN: New SEC Chairman Paul Atkins calls out the previous SEC administration led by Gensler.

“Innovation, unfortunately has been stifled for the last several years due to market and regulatory uncertainty that unfortunately the SEC has fostered.”
